_Defines the creative tone and aesthetic language._

# Music Style

* Genre references (e.g., synthwave, orchestral, jazz)
* Emotional pacing
* Dynamic systems (adaptive score, stems, transitions)
* Key motifs, themes, leitmotifs
* Tempo maps for important gameplay moments
* In/out-of-combat music rules

# Sound Effects Style

* Foley vs synthetic
* Texture descriptors (crunchy, squishy, crisp, retro, sci-fi)
* Frequency ranges to emphasize/avoid
* Editing conventions (bit depth, reverb preferences, transient shape)
* Loudness targets (e.g., -23 LUFS broadcast standard or game-specific)

# Voice Acting / Dialogue Style

* Character vocal archetypes
* Performance direction
* Accent, tone, pacing
* Recording guidelines
* File naming and line-reading instructions
* Localization notes (multilingual support)
